page.title: 01OVERVIEW
page.content:
The landscape of this Domesday Block is very picturesque. It is dominated by the River Nene which meanders through eight of the twelve kilometre squares. This fertile valley area supports a number of farms given mainly to crop growing although there is some animal husbandry. There is a gravel quarry but otherwise no other industry in the area other than farming.
The whole area contains parts of three villages. Populations, at present, are reasonably stable. Apart form those engaged directly in farming, many of the local residents find occupation in neighbouring towns, such as Oundle, Peterborough and Corby.
Pages 2 to 15 have been written by children aged seven to nine in the Junior Section of Warmington School.
